articles.headline: No BP Word as Deadline Slides By
articles.snippet: BP did not issue a statement on Monday, leading some analysts to indicate that the two sides would continue to negotiate to try to revise terms so it could search for offshore oil in the Arctic.
articles.abstract: BP did not issue a statement on Monday, leading some analysts to indicate that the two sides would continue to negotiate to try to revise terms so it could search for offshore oil in the Arctic.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — A Monday midnight deadline passed without word from BP and the Russian oil giant Rosneft on whether they had been able to salvage a deal in which they would invest in each other and jointly search for offshore oil in the Arctic.
articles.byline: By Julia Werdigier and Andrew E. Kramer

articles.headline: Japanese Officials Ignored or Concealed Dangers
articles.snippet: The nuclear disaster has shed new light on the legal battles that critics of the system have lost for years.
articles.abstract: The nuclear disaster has shed new light on the legal battles that critics of the system have lost for years.
articles.lead_paragraph: OMAEZAKI, Japan — The nuclear power plant, lawyers argued, could not withstand the kind of major earthquake that new seismic research now suggested was likely.
articles.byline: By Norimitsu Onishi and Martin Fackler

articles.headline: Ultimatum Holding Up Trade Deals
articles.snippet: The White House says it will not submit trade pacts with three nations for Congressional approval until Republicans agreed to aid for workers losing jobs in the deals.
articles.abstract: The White House says it will not submit trade pacts with three nations for Congressional approval until Republicans agreed to aid for workers losing jobs in the deals.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Obama administration said on Monday that it would not seek Congressional approval of free trade agreements with Colombia, Panama and South Korea until Republicans agree to expand assistance for American workers who might lose jobs as a result.

articles.headline: A Once-Tight Flock at Goldman, Now Scattered
articles.snippet: As its original partners leave, the elite at Goldman Sachs hold less control over the firm, giving way to the demands of outside shareholders. And the partners’ power base may soon erode further.
articles.abstract: As its original partners leave, the elite at Goldman Sachs hold less control over the firm, giving way to the demands of outside shareholders. And the partners’ power base may soon erode further.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Goldman Sachs went public 12 years ago this month, an elite group of 221 executives controlled the strategy and shares of the investment bank.

articles.headline: Costly Hairstyle Is a Beauty Trend That Draws Thieves’ Notice
articles.snippet: Hair used for extensions has become so valuable that thieves sometimes bypass the cash register and go right for the hair.
articles.abstract: Hair used for extensions has become so valuable that thieves sometimes bypass the cash register and go right for the hair.
articles.lead_paragraph: The thieves pulled the iron bars out of the windows, outsmarted the motion detector that would have triggered a burglar alarm and did not give the safe or cash register a second look.

articles.headline: New York Investigates Banks’ Role in Financial Crisis
articles.snippet: The New York attorney general has requested information from three major Wall Street banks about their mortgage securities operations during the credit boom.
articles.abstract: The New York attorney general has requested information from three major Wall Street banks about their mortgage securities operations during the credit boom.
articles.lead_paragraph: The New York attorney general has requested information and documents in recent weeks from three major Wall Street banks about their mortgage securities operations during the credit boom, indicating the existence of a new investigation into practices that contributed to billions in mortgage losses.

articles.headline: Schwarzenegger Whispers Become an Admission
articles.snippet: Stories of an affair and a child were flying around eight years ago, when Arnold Schwarzenegger ran for office.
articles.abstract: Stories of an affair and a child were flying around eight years ago, when Arnold Schwarzenegger ran for office.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — The stories were flying around eight years ago, when Arnold Schwarzenegger was in the midst of his unlikely attempt to unseat Gray Davis, the Democratic governor: Mr. Schwarzenegger, married to Maria Shriver, had fathered a child with a woman who worked at the couple’s Brentwood estate.
articles.byline: By Adam Nagourney and Jennifer Steinhauer

articles.headline: Libyan City Buries Its Attackers Respectfully
articles.snippet: Misurata’s residents have insisted that the remains of the Qaddafi troops be treated with dignity.
articles.abstract: Misurata’s residents have insisted that the remains of the Qaddafi troops be treated with dignity.
articles.lead_paragraph: MISURATA, Libya — The gravediggers worked methodically and with few words. By now their grisly labor was a routine.
